edu.mit.lib.bagit

Class Filler

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.mit.lib.bagit.Filler

  • public class Filler
extends java.lang.Object
    Filler is a builder class used to construct bags conformant to LC Bagit spec - version 0.97. Filler objects serialize themselves to either a loose directory, a compressed archive file (supported formats zip or tgz) or a stream, abiding by the serialization recommendations of the specification. See README for sample invocations and API description.

        Returns a new Filler (bag builder) instance using passed directory to hold bag, default checksum algorithm (MD5), and system-defined line separator

      • Filler

        public Filler(java.nio.file.Path base,
              java.lang.String csAlgorithm)
       throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a new filler (bag builder) instances using passed directory and checksum algorithm, and system-defined line separator
        Parameters:
        base - directory for bag - if null, create temporary directory
        csAlgorithm - checksum algorithm string - if null use default
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if error creating bag

      • Filler

        public Filler(java.nio.file.Path base,
              java.lang.String csAlgorithm,
              Filler.EolRule eolRule)
       throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a new filler (bag builder) instances using passed directory, checksum algorithm, and line separator for text files.
        Parameters:
        base - directory for bag - if null, create temporary directory
        csAlgorithm - checksum algorithm string - if null use default
        eolRule - line termination rule to use for generated text files. Values are: SYSTEM - use system-defined line termination COUNTER_SYSTEM - if on Windows, use Unix EOL, else reverse UNIX - use newline character line termination WINDOWS - use CR/LF line termination
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if error creating bag

    • Method Detail

      • noAutoGen

        public Filler noAutoGen()
        Disables the automatic generation of metadata. Normally generated: Bagging-Date, Bag-Size, Payload-Oxnum, Bag-Software-Agent
        Returns:
        Filler this Filler

        public Filler autoGen(java.util.Set<Bag.MetadataName> names)

      • toPackage

        public java.nio.file.Path toPackage()
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Returns bag serialized as an archive file using default packaging (zip archive) assigning zip timestamps
        Returns:
        path the bag archive package path
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if error reading bag

      • toPackage

        public java.nio.file.Path toPackage(java.lang.String format,
                                    boolean noTime)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Returns bag serialized as an archive file using passed packaging format. Supported formats: 'zip' - zip archive, 'tgz' - gzip compressed tar archive
        Parameters:
        format - the package format ('zip', or 'tgz')
        noTime - if 'true', suppress regular timestamp assignment in archive
        Returns:
        path the bag archive package path
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if error reading bag

      • toStream

        public java.io.InputStream toStream()
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Returns bag serialized as an IO stream using default packaging (zip archive). Bag is deleted when stream closed if temporary bag location used.
        Returns:
        InputStream of the bag archive package
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if error reading bag

      • toStream

        public java.io.InputStream toStream(java.lang.String format,
                                    boolean noTime)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Returns bag serialized as an IO stream using passed packaging format. Bag is deleted when stream closed if temporary bag location used. Supported formats: 'zip' - zip archive, 'tgz' - gzip compressed tar archive
        Parameters:
        format - the package format ('zip', or 'tgz')
        noTime - if 'true', suppress regular timestamp assignment in archive
        Returns:
        InputStream of the bag archive package
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if error reading bag
